topic.title: Manage Time Conditions
topic.shortdesc: After you create Time Conditions, you can apply them to inbound routes or outbound routes. You can also edit or delete the Time Conditions.

section.title: Apply a Time Condition to an Inbound Route
section.p: You can apply a Time Condition to an inbound route to route inbound calls to different destinations according to your business hours and schedule.

ol.li: Go to Settings PBX Call Control Inbound Routes , click beside the inbound route that you want to edit.
On the Inbound Route page, select the checkbox of Enable Time Condition.
Click , and select a Time Condition from the drop-down list.

Select destination from the drop-down list.
Inbound calls will be routed to the pre-configured destination if the date and time of the calls match the time condition.

section.title: Apply a Time Condition to an Outbound Route
section.p: You can apply a Time Condition to an outbound route to limit when the extension users can make outbound calls.

ol.li: Go to Settings PBX Call Control Outbound Routes , click beside the outbound route that you want to edit.

On the Outbound Routes page, select the Time Condition which will be applied to the outbound route.
Only in this time period can extension users make outbound calls via this outbound route.
Go to Settings PBX Call Control Time Conditions , click beside the Time Condition that you want to edit.
Change Time Condition settings according to your needs.

section.title: Delete a Time Condition
section.p: After deleting a Time Condition, related configurations of the Time Condition in both inbound routes and outbound routes will be deleted automatically.

ol.li: Go to Settings PBX Call Control Time Conditions , click beside the Time Condition that you want to delete.
On the pop-up window, click Yes and Apply.
